newsitem.title: UK: Mauritius sugar output to rise by year 2000 - MSS.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius sugar output to rise by year 2000 - MSS.

text.p: Mauritius should increase its annual sugar production by 50,000 tonnes by the year 2000, the director of the Mauritius Sugar Syndicate (MSS) said on Tuesday.
"Certain measures are being implemented," Michel Hardy told a two-day seminar hosted by the International Sugar Organization (ISO).
"The objective is to increase (production) by 50,000 tonnes within the next three or four years...or by the turn of the century." Hardy said.

A normal cane harvest -- meaning a crop unaffected by cyclones or other unfavourable weather conditions such as drought -- would produce 650,000 tonnes of sugar but, he added Mauritius had an annual sugar production target of 700,000 tonnes.
The ISO has forecast Mauritius 1996/97 sugar production at 610,000 tonnes raw value for the October/September crop year, unchanged from 1995/96.
